title: No goodbyes for Schweinsteiger
text:
Bastian Schweinsteiger didn't get the chance to say goodbye to Man Utd team-mates By PA Sport Last Updated: 29/03/17 11:31pm Bastian Schweinsteiger in unveiled in Chicago Bastian Schweinsteiger has revealed he did not get the chance to properly say goodbye to his Manchester United team-mates before signing for Chicago Fire. 
The German's move to the Major League Soccer club was officially confirmed by United on Wednesday afternoon after the formality of his visa had been resolved. 
Schweinsteiger's stay at Old Trafford ended last week after he agreed to join Chicago Fire on a one-year contract. 
But so rushed was the deal, he revealed he did not have the opportunity to bid farewell to the United players - who were busy preparing for their Premier League game away at Middlesbrough. Highlights: Middlesbrough 1-3 Man Utd 
"It was not so easy because the decision was a bit late so I couldn't say a proper goodbye to the team," Schweinsteiger said. 
"Also they had a match away against - I can't remember - but they had a match on Sunday so I couldn't really tell them because I didn't want the focus on me, I wanted to have the focus on the team and the game. So I was very happy that they won. S'land vs Man Utd
